definition.name: NXcs_profiling_event

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

definition.doc: Computer science description of a profiling event.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the event tracking started.

field.name: end_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the event tracking ended.

field.name: description
field.doc: Free-text description what was monitored/executed during the event.

field.name: elapsed_time
field.doc: Wall-clock time how long the event took. This may be in principle end_time minus start_time; however usage of eventually more precise timers may warrant to use a finer temporal discretization, and thus demand a more precise record of the wall-clock time. Elapsed time may contain time portions where resources were idling.

field.name: number_of_processes
field.doc: Number of processes used (max) during the execution of this event.

field.name: number_of_threads
field.doc: Number of threads used (max) during the execution of this event.

field.name: number_of_gpus
field.doc: Number of GPUs used (max) during the execution of this event.

field.name: max_virtual_memory_snapshot
field.doc: Maximum amount of virtual memory allocated per process during the event.

field.name: max_resident_memory_snapshot
field.doc: Maximum amount of resident memory allocated per process during the event.
